title: Simulator-Based Instructional Design for Training Focal Cardiac Ultrasound (FoCUS) Experts

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Self-directed learning environments using simulators and digital devices, emphasizing team-based problem-solving activities

learning_goals: Learners can independently acquire the four standard views of the heart (parasternal, apical, subcostal, suprasternal) using the FoCUS probe.
Learners can identify cardiac dysfunctions (e.g., reduced ventricular contractility, pericardial effusion) with over 85% accuracy.
Learners achieve technical proficiency of 90+ points (out of 100) in three consecutive simulation evaluations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
